intro: Oplismenus pictus, commonly known as the painted spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique and colorful floral structures. The plant features bright yellow flowers that are often surrounded by distinctive red or orange bracts, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, glossy surface. Oplismenus pictus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
